text: John White (? – 22 August 1692, in St. Andrews), was acting Governor of Jamaica in 1692. Previously President of the Council, White was acting Governor during the 1692 earthquake that destroyed Port Royal. The historian William James Gardner wrote of him: John Bourden succeeded him for a brief time as Governor. ==Notes== Category:1692 deaths Category:Governors of Jamaica Category:Jamaican people of English descent Category:17th-century Jamaican people
title: John White (colonial administrator)
